_description: Rhyming headings in a sermon on the failings of women, 9 lines, first two rhyme together, the rest are monorhyming

OxfMert248.Editions:
Pfander,  Homer Garrison. 
             “The Popular Sermon of the Medieval Friar in England.” 
         Diss. New York University, 1937: 50.

CULIi38.Transcription:
Swynes hallesffendes fallechurch robberWraþe
                    worcherherte renderWytte wenderlonde leserand lyf
                    reuer
CULIi38.Note:
In a sermon for Corpus Christi, Panem de celo prestitisti eis by
                    Lawrence Bretoun, OFM; four couplets
CULIi38.Editions:
Stemmler,  Theo. 
             “More English Texts from MS. Cambridge University Library
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Anglia
         93 (1975): 1-16: 6.
